articles.headline: In California, What Price Water?
articles.snippet: A plant for making seawater drinkable in Carlsbad, Calif., will offer a peek into a future when prices for water reflect the real costs of obtaining it.
articles.abstract: A plant for making seawater drinkable in Carlsbad, Calif., will offer a peek into a future when prices for water reflect the real costs of obtaining it.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARLSBAD, Calif. — On a calm day, a steady rain just about masks the sound of Pacific Ocean water being drawn into the intake valve from Agua Hedionda Lagoon. Listen hard, and a faint sucking sound emerges from the concrete openings, like a distant straw pulling liquid from a cup.

articles.headline: U.S.D.A. May Approve Horse Slaughtering
articles.snippet: If the U.S.D.A. approves a New Mexico horse slaughtering plant, it would be the first time since 2007 that equine meat for human consumption would be produced in the United States.
articles.abstract: If the U.S.D.A. approves a New Mexico horse slaughtering plant, it would be the first time since 2007 that equine meat for human consumption would be produced in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States Department of Agriculture is likely to approve a horse slaughtering plant in New Mexico in the next two months, which would allow equine meat suitable for human consumption to be produced in the United States for the first time since 2007.

articles.headline: Fighting Shortages, Syrian Civilians Take Reins in Rebel Areas
articles.snippet: Local councils in rebel-held towns are trying to set up courts, police forces and social services, amounting to Syria’s first experiments in self-government after years under the Assads.
articles.abstract: Local councils in rebel-held towns are trying to set up courts, police forces and social services, amounting to Syria’s first experiments in self-government after years under the Assads.
articles.lead_paragraph: TILALYAN, Syria — Bundled in a thick overcoat against the frosty afternoon, Mohamed Moussa watched with concern as the town baker worked by flashlight to repair the conveyor belt on his aging oven, the town’s principal food source.

articles.headline: Groupon Dismisses Chief After a Dismal Quarter
articles.snippet: The daily deals Web site reported weak fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday, and fired its chief executive, Andrew Mason, a day later.
articles.abstract: The daily deals Web site reported weak fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday, and fired its chief executive, Andrew Mason, a day later.
articles.lead_paragraph: Andrew Mason, the irreverent programmer and musician who turned a failed social action site into the daily deals phenomenon Groupon, was dismissed Thursday as chief executive.

articles.headline: Boehner Halts Talks on Cuts, and House G.O.P. Cheers
articles.snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner seems to have decided that he may have more to lose by negotiating with the White House over spending cuts that begin Friday than by letting them happen.
articles.abstract: Speaker John A. Boehner seems to have decided that he may have more to lose by negotiating with the White House over spending cuts that begin Friday than by letting them happen.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Speaker John A. Boehner, the man who spent significant portions of the last Congress shuttling to and from the White House for fiscal talks with President Obama that ultimately failed twice to produce a grand bargain, has come around to the idea that the best negotiations are no negotiations.

articles.headline: Refusing to Be Late on Gay Marriage
articles.snippet: Corporate America has historically been slow to take up civil rights issues, but companies have rushed to show support for same-sex marriage.
articles.abstract: Corporate America has historically been slow to take up civil rights issues, but companies have rushed to show support for same-sex marriage.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Human Rights Campaign approached Lloyd Blankfein, Goldman Sachs’s chairman and chief executive, a few years ago about making a short commercial in support of same-sex marriage, Mr. Blankfein said he had the impression he’d be one of a number of prominent business executives taking a public stand.

articles.headline: As Cuts Arrive, Parties Pledge to Call Off the Budget Wars
articles.snippet: As a deal to break a budget impasse failed to emerge on Friday, both the president and his Republican adversaries said they would not carry the fight over the cuts into the coming effort to finance the government.
articles.abstract: As a deal to break a budget impasse failed to emerge on Friday, both the president and his Republican adversaries said they would not carry the fight over the cuts into the coming effort to finance the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: A more recent article on the spending cuts can be found here.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Jonathan Weisman
